alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued February 20 at 3:49AM MST until February 21 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT TODAY FROM 11 AM TO 7 PM FOR THE EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY VALUES, AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT MONDAY FOR EASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY VALUES AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS... .Increasing westerlies, strong mixing, and a deepening lee side trough combined with very dry conditions, above normal temperatures, and an unstable atmosphere will bring several hours of critical fire weather conditions to the East Central Plains today. Winds will increase further on Monday, allowing for critical fire weather conditions to develop across all of eastern New Mexico. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...This includes the Northeast Plains, Northeast Highlands and the Sandia, Manzano and Gallinas Mountains below significant snowpack late Monday morning through early evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwesterly 20 to 35 mph with gusts near 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values between 9 and 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch for Monday.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains
